title: Actor Robert Carradine Passes Away, Remembered by Friends
summary: Robert Carradine, a famous actor from movies like Revenge of the Nerds and the TV show Lizzie McGuire, has died at age 71. His family shared that he had bipolar disorder, a mental health condition, for almost 20 years and died by suicide. They want people to know about his struggle to help reduce the shame often linked to mental illness. Hilary Duff, who played his daughter on Lizzie McGuire, posted a sad message on Instagram, saying she felt cared for by him and is heartbroken. Carradine was part of a family of actors and started his career in a John Wayne film. He acted in many other movies, including Django Unchained, but is most remembered for his funny and kind roles. His family described him as a loving father and a bright light to others, hoping his story encourages more understanding and support for mental health issues.

Mental health conditions like bipolar disorder affect how people feel and act, and it's important to talk about them without shame to help others get support.
